content: to fit this smaller version of the standard size weebee doll dummy/pacifier part one round 1 with chosen colour blue in example magic_ring ch1 not a st work 10hdc join last st to first with a slip_stitch 10sts round 2 ch2 counts as first st work 2hdc into the next st work 2dc into the next st work 2hdc into the next st ch2 and slip_stitch into the next st slip_stitch into the next st ch2 counts as a st work 2hdc into the next st work 2dc into the next st work 2hdc into the next st ch2 and slip_stitch into the last st fasten_off leaving a long tail to sew the dummy onto the mouth part two with chosen colour white in example magic_ring ch1 not a st work 10hdc join last st to first with a slip_stitch 10sts fasten_off leaving a tail use the tail to sew this part on top of the coloured part above working in and out just beneath the stitches as pictured gives a good 3d effect hide any loose ends finally use finishing tail from part one to sew the dummy onto the doll s head again working just beneath the outer stitches will give a 3d effect to the dummy ~ 6 ~ onesie closure row 1 with chosen colour green in example ch7 single_crochet into the second chain from the hook single_crochet into each remaining chain across turn 6sts row 2 ch1 single_crochet into each st across 6sts fasten_off leaving a tail to sew this onto the body before you do though to give the effect of buttons or poppers simply take a length of contrasting coloured yarn blue in example and sew a few buttons working over the stitches a couple of times per button hide the loose ends from your buttons using tail left before sew the closure onto the body as pictured again working just beneath the edges will give a more realistic 3d effect finishing touches… colour those cheeks to add colour to your dolls cheeks you can use ordinary makeup blush and a blusher brush sweep it beneath the eye at an angle up towards the hair line ~ ~ i really hope you have enjoyed this pattern please share your weebee projects with us on the weebee appreciation society facebook page link on page 1 and don t forget to add your project to ravelry ~ 7 ~
